Title and abstract.title: Promise the Moon? Easy for Trump. But Now Comes the Reckoning.
Title and abstract.abstract: On issues like health care and Iran, President Trump’s language has not been matched by action, raising questions about whether his base will be satisfied by partial steps.

Title and abstract.title: Black Lawmakers Hold a Particular Grievance With Facebook: Racial Exploitation
Title and abstract.abstract: Sheryl Sandberg’s meeting on Thursday with the Congressional Black Caucus afforded lawmakers a chance to vent over Russia’s exploitation of racial division.

Title and abstract.title: End to Health Care Subsidies Puts Congress in a Tight Spot
Title and abstract.abstract: Some lawmakers want to fund the payments to insurers that President Trump is cutting off, while the president says Democrats should negotiate with him.

Title and abstract.title: Trump Disavows Nuclear Deal, but Doesn’t Scrap It
Title and abstract.abstract: President Trump said he would seek Congress to define “trigger points,” that could prompt the United States to reimpose sanctions on Iran if violated.

Title and abstract.title: ‘The New Washington’: Breitbart in the White House
Title and abstract.abstract: In this week’s episode, Charlie Spiering, a White House correspondent for Breitbart News, spoke to The Times about how he does his job, what he makes of the controversy surrounding his employer and more.

Title and abstract.title: Trump Tweets Approval After Health Care Stocks ‘Plunged’
Title and abstract.abstract: President Trump cut off subsidies to cover insurance costs for low-income people, and some health care stocks fell. He cheered.

Title and abstract.title: Documenting U.S. Role in Democracy’s Fall and Dictator’s Rise in Chile
Title and abstract.abstract: An exhibition at the Museum of Memory and Human Rights in Santiago displays once-secret documents that describe covert operations and intelligence gathering on the Pinochet dictatorship.

Title and abstract.title: 4 Ways Trump Has Moved to Undo His Predecessors’ Legacies
Title and abstract.abstract: President Trump has promised sweeping changes to health care, immigration, the Iran deal and trade. Here’s a look at where things stand now.

Title and abstract.title: Back Home, a Unanimous Verdict on Corker vs. Trump: That’s Just Bob
Title and abstract.abstract: The nation has seen Mr. Corker, a reliable Republican senator from a deep-red state, stunningly undermining his president. Chattanooga has seen it coming, for better or worse.

Title and abstract.title: Wary of Hackers, States Move to Upgrade Voting Systems
Title and abstract.abstract: New equipment and security protocols are part of the response to Russian meddling in 2016. But lack of money is an obstacle.

Title and abstract.title: Canadian Held Hostage in Afghanistan Says Militants Killed His Child
Title and abstract.abstract: Joshua Boyle, who with his family was freed by Pakistani troops, also said his wife had been raped during their five-year captivity by the Haqqani network.

Title and abstract.title: Iowa’s Swing to Republicans Is a Matter of (Lacking a) Degree
Title and abstract.abstract: Iowa’s status as a swing state in presidential elections may be in doubt. One key reason: Its economy cannot support enough college graduates. That’s bad news for Democrats.
